item.title: WARNING: UNPROTECTED PRIVATE KEY FILE!
item.description:
I was planning to do a clean install after macOS Catalina was released. I copied my ssh keys and I’ve seen the warning when I tried to run git-related commands.

After a short research, I’ve found out the source of the problem is the permissions on the private key file.

item.title: Upgrading Ubuntu Server LTS from 16.04 to 18.04
item.description: Ubuntu 18.04, aka Bionic Beaver, was released on 26 April 2018. In this post, I will try to explain how do I upgrade my Ubuntu server. I will also inform you about how I overcome the obstacles related python hosting.

item.title: How I do backup my server using Dropbox headless
item.description: I have experienced a disaster on my web server a few days ago. While trying to remove one of my dev databases, I have removed the production database accidentally. I was extremely lucky because I duplicated production database to the local one to test a python script and I have all my web app’s content in the GIT history which you shouldn’t. Because it is not the best practice to put web app’s content to the VCS.
